articles.author: Debora MacKenzie
articles.title: How bad is the Covid-19 coronavirus outbreak likely to get?
articles.description: The death rate of Covid-19, caused by the new coronavirus, may be lower than some estimates suggest, but the number of cases may be much higher
articles.content:
By Debora MacKenzie
Sterilisation efforts in Lianyungang, China
TPG/Zuma Press/PA Images
The World Health Organization has now named the new coronavirus disease: Covid-19.
If the virus isnt halted, it could infect 60 per cent of the worlds population and … [+3160 chars]

articles.author: Michael Le Page
articles.title: Covid-19: The new coronavirus now officially has a name
articles.description: The new coronavirus began spreading in China during December 2019, but it has only now been officially named as Covid-19 by the World Health Organization
articles.content:
By Michael Le Page
Chinese officials have begun disinfecting to tackle Covid-19
 Zhang Peng/LightRocket via Getty Images
There is now have an official name for the disease caused by the new coronavirus, which has killed more than 1000 people so far: Covid-… [+1675 chars]

articles.author: Michael Le Page
articles.title: Could the new coronavirus really kill 50 million people worldwide?
articles.description: No one can say for sure how widely the new coronavirus will spread and how many it will kill because there are still many key things we do not know - not least the wider impact on healthcare services
articles.content:
By Michael Le Page
There are many things we don’t know about the new coronavirus
Li Jianan/Xinhua News Agency/PA Images
If the spread of the new coronavirus is not halted, it could infect 60 per cent of the worlds population and kill 1 in 100 of those infe… [+4561 chars]
